title: Great Britain, France and Belgium: a short tour in 1835
author: Humphrey, Heman
snippet: I was indebted to Dr. Beilby, one of theproprietors, and a physician of high standing, foran hour's walk in these Elysian Fields, as well as formany other civilities, during my short stay in Edinburgh. The New Town, since the original plan wasformed, has been very much extended, particularly tothe north, where you grow weary in admiring the Royal Crescent, Royal Circus, Drummond Place, MorayPlace, and many other superb blocks of private dwellings. Whether the New Town of Edinburgh hasany " rival in Europe or in the world," I cannot tell.
